alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:20AM EST until January 11 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River near Bynum. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left. At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The river widens up to 800 feet across, but flooding remains confined to extensive stretches of woods and pastureland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Wednesday was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 4.6 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.1 feet on 04/25/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Haw River Bynum 11.0 14.7 Wed 10 am ES 9.1 6.5 5.4 5.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
